meanings.definition: An act or instance of parodying or imitating someone or something in a humorous way.
meanings.sent1: The comedy show included hilarious sendups of famous politicians.
meanings.sent2: The sendups of popular songs at the talent show had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent3: The sendups of classic fairy tales were a hit with the audience.
meanings.sent4: His sendups of movie scenes were so spot-on, they felt like the real thing.
meanings.sent5: The sendups of famous paintings brought a new level of humor to the art exhibit.

meanings.definition: To parody or imitate someone or something in a humorous way.
meanings.sent1: She loves to sendups her favorite TV characters in her comedy sketches.
meanings.sent2: The comedian decided to sendups the latest viral dance craze in his performance.
meanings.sent3: They planned to sendups the famous movie scene at the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: His ability to sendups famous actors made him a popular entertainer.
meanings.sent5: The group wanted to sendups the serious news anchor in a lighthearted skit.
